parent_formation: 57th Fighter Group, IX Fighter Command, 9th Air Force

commander.name: Unknown (not documented in available sources for Q4 1942)

base: LG-174 (Landing Ground 174), Burg El Arab, Egypt

operations_history.operation: Second Battle of El Alamein (air superiority)

sources: Asisbiz.com - 57th Fighter Group history with primary source citations (P-40 serial numbers 41-13947, 41-14081)
57th Fighter Group official deployment records (72 P-40F aircraft launched from USS Ranger, July 1942)
American Air Museum - 65th Fighter Squadron operational history
IX Fighter Command historical records - Egypt deployment July 1942
History of War - 57th Fighter Group combat operations October 1942
metadata.notes: Squadron deployed to Egypt September 16, 1942 as part of 57th Fighter Group (72 P-40F total for group, estimated 24 per squadron). Began combat operations October 1942 during Second Battle of El Alamein. Specific P-40 variants documented via Asisbiz.com (P-40F-10-CU and P-40E-CU with serial numbers). Commander name not documented in available sources for Q4 1942. Personnel estimates based on standard USAAF fighter squadron TO&E. Notable pilots included 1Lt Roy E. Whittaker (victories Oct 26-27, 1942) and Lt Gilbert O. Wymond Jr. Source validation: ~70% Tier 1/2 facts (aircraft variants, deployment dates, battles, parent formation), ~30% Wikipedia/general sources (organizational context).
metadata.witw_validation: No direct WITW airgroup match found in available database

source_validation.hybrid_validation_notes: Aircraft variants (P-40F-10-CU, P-40E-CU) confirmed via Asisbiz.com Tier 2 source with serial numbers. Deployment dates and 72 P-40F aircraft count confirmed via multiple military history sources. Battle participation (El Alamein) confirmed via USAAF operational records. Personnel estimates derived from standard USAAF squadron TO&E. Commander name gap remains - not documented in available sources for Q4 1942 timeframe.
